original_content:
Today's verses: Ps. 27:9-10

9 Do not hide Your face from me. Do not angrily turn me away. You have been
my help. Do not leave me!

Do not abandon me, O God, my Savior! 

10 Even if my father and mother abandon me, the Lord will take care of me. 

Today's Thoughts:

Many have had the sad experience of being abandon by their father and
mother. 

Broken homes, difference of belief, addiction to drugs or alcohol-and the
list goes on.

These things can cause children to feel isolated and crippled. Even as
adults, the pain may linger.

God can take that place in our life. He can fill that void, and heal that
hurt. He can direct us to 

adults who may take the role of a father or mother for us. His love is
sufficient for all our needs. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, teach me how to live, lead me in paths of righteousness. Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

It is always good to start the day with prayer!

These things can cause children to feel isolated and crippled. Even as adults, the pain may linger. God can take that place in our life. He can fill that void, and heal that hurt. He can direct us to adults who may take the role of a father or mother for us. His love is sufficient for all our needs.
original_verse_text: Do not hide Your face from me. Do not angrily turn me away. You have been my help. Do not leave me! Do not abandon me, O God, my Savior! 10 Even if my father and mother abandon me, the Lord will take care of me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with hearts that have been wounded by the abandonment and brokenness of earthly relationships. In the midst of our pain and isolation, we are reminded of Your promise to have plans for our lives, to draw us near, and to be found by us when we seek You with all our hearts. Lord, fill the void left by those who have failed us, and heal the hurt that lingers. May Your perfect love and steadfast presence be the comfort and guidance we need. We trust in Your unfailing love. Amen.

These things can cause children to feel isolated and crippled. Even as adults, the pain may linger. God can take that place in our life. He can fill that void and heal that hurt. He can direct us to adults who may take the role of a father or mother for us. His love is sufficient for all our needs.
subject: Healing the Abandoned Heart

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 27:13-14

13 I believe that I will see the goodness of the Lord in this world of the
living. 
14 Wait with hope for the Lord. Be strong, and let your heart be courageous.
Yes, wait with hope for the Lord. 

Today's Thoughts:

The "land of the living" simply means this life. David was obviously going
through some trial-but 

he was confident that in this present life, God would see him through it. He
knew from experience 

what it meant to wait for the Lord. He had been anoint king at the age of 16
but did not become king 

until he was 30. During the interim he was chased through the wilderness by
jealous King Saul. 

David had to wait on God for the fulfillment of his promise to reign. After
becoming king he was 

chased by his rebellious son Absalom.

Often it seems that God isn't answering our prayers or doesn't understand
the urgency of our situation. 

That kind of thinking implies that God is not in control or is not fair. BUT
God is worth waiting for. 

Make good use of your waiting times by discovering what God may be trying to
teach you in them. .

Today's prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, teach me patience and show me that I can take You 

at Your word whenever You speak. Amen



Pastor AL & Marcie Sather

The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are worthless.

I Cor. 3:20

He knew from experience what it meant to wait for the Lord. He had been anoint king at the age of 16 but did not become king until he was 30. During the interim he was chased through the wilderness by jealous King Saul. David had to wait on God for the fulfillment of his promise to reign. After becoming king he was chased by his rebellious son Absalom. Often it seems that God isn't answering our prayers or doesn't understand the urgency of our situation. That kind of thinking implies that God is not in control or is not fair. BUT God is worth waiting for. Make good use of your waiting times by discovering what God may be trying to teach you in them. .

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that Your timing is perfect, even when it does not align with our own. Like David, we trust that You will see us through the trials of this life, for You are the God of the living. Help us to wait patiently for Your perfect plan to unfold, knowing that You are in control and that Your ways are higher than our own. May we use this time of waiting to grow in our faith and to discover the lessons You have for us. We believe that we will see Your goodness in the land of the living. Amen.

Today's Verses: Ps. 28:1-5

O Lord, I call to you. O my rock, do not turn a deaf ear to me. If you
remain silent, I will be like those who go into the pit. 

2 Hear my prayer for mercy when I call to you for help, when I lift my hands
toward your most holy place. 

3 Do not drag me away with wicked people, with troublemakers who speak of
peace with their neighbors but have evil in their hearts. 

4 Pay them back for what they have done, for their evil deeds. Pay them back
for what their hands have done, and give them what they deserve. 

5 The Lord will tear them down and never build them up again, because they
never consider what he has done or what his hands have made. 

Today's Thoughts:

God is our only real source of safety-Prayer is our best help when trials
come our waybecause it keeps us in communion with God. It is easy to pretend friendship.
Wicked people 

often put on a show of kindness or friendship in order to gain their own
ends.

BUT true believers should be straight-forward and sincere in all their
relationships. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, You are my rock of safety, protect me from Satan's skims 

so that I may walk according to Your will. .Amen.





Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

"Fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom." Pro. 1:7
original_reflection_text: God is our only real source of safety-Prayer is our best help when trials come our waybecause it keeps us in communion with God. It is easy to pretend friendship. Wicked people often put on a show of kindness or friendship in order to gain their own ends. BUT true believers should be straightforward and sincere in all their relationships. .

Pay them back for what their hands have done, and give them what they deserve. 5 The Lord will tear them down and never build them up again, because they never consider what he has done or what his hands have made.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You as our refuge and strength, our ever-present help in times of trouble. Guide us to walk with integrity and faithfulness, that our lives may reflect Your steadfast love and kindness. May our words and actions be a true testament of our devotion to You, not mere pretense. Keep us steadfast in prayer, that we may remain in communion with You and find safety in Your presence. We trust in Your unfailing love. Amen.

Wicked people often put on a show of kindness or friendship in order to gain their own ends. But true believers should be straightforward and sincere in all their relationships.

Today's Verse: Ps. 28:5 
Because they do not regard the works of the Lord or the work of His hands, 
He will tear them down and build them up no more. 
Today's Thoughts:
One could say these people were two-face by what we see in verse 3 
"They were friendly to their neighbors while planning evil in their hearts."
We really need to think about our attitude, oh and our pleasures-if they 
do not have God's blessing-they just may destroy us. 
Leaving God out of or life will allow sin to come in. God wants us to enjoy
lifebut to avoid those activities that could lead us away from Him.
Today's Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, stand at my side and keep me standing beside 
You every one of my days. Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather
Keep My commandments in your heart, for they will prolong your life many
years.
Pro. 3:12

Help us to guard our hearts and minds, that we may not be deceived by the allure of sin, which can so easily lead us astray. Grant us the wisdom to discern Your path and the strength to walk in it, that we may find true joy and fulfillment in living according to Your perfect plan. May our lives be a testament to Your love and grace. Amen.

God wants us to enjoy life, but to avoid those activities that could lead us away from Him.

Today's Verses: Ps. 28:6, 7

6 Blessed be the Lord! For he has heard the voice of my pleas for mercy. 

7 The Lord is my strength and my shield; in him my heart trusts, and I am
helped; 

my heart exults, and with my song I give thanks to him. 

Today's Thoughts:

God is so responsive that you can always reach Him.

He bends down and listens to your voice.

Remember that God is near, listening carefully to every 

prayer and answering each one in order to give you His best.

As we understand the future He has for us, we will experience joy.

Don't base your life on circumstances, but on God. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, remind me day to day that You care

for me as one of Your family. Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

I will thank the Lord because He is just;

I will sing praises to the name of the Lord Most High.

Remember that God is near, listening carefully to every prayer and answering each one in order to give you His best. As we understand the future He has for us, we will experience joy. Don't base your life on circumstances, but on God. .

You are a God who is near, who listens carefully to our prayers and answers with Your perfect plan. Help us to seek You with our whole hearts, trusting that as we draw near to You, we will find the joy and peace of walking in Your ways. May our lives be firmly rooted in You, not the ever-changing circumstances of this world. Amen.

Today's Verses: Ps. 28:8-9

8 The Lord is the strength of His people; He is the saving refuge of His
anointed. 

9 Oh, save Your people and bless Your heritage! Be their Shepherd and carry
them forever. 

Today's Thoughts:

God alone can save you so be sure your confidence is in Him-only He can give
you eternal victory.

When you feel lost, it maybe because you are looking everywhere but to God
for your help and guidance.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, remind me that Your hands are strong enough

to handle all my needs. Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

There was never any heart truly great and generous 

that was not also tender and compassionate.
original_reflection_text: God alone can save you so be sure your confidence is in Him-only He can give you eternal victory. When you feel lost, it maybe because you are looking everywhere but to God for your help and guidance.
original_verse_text: 8 The Lord is the strength of His people; He is the saving refuge of His anointed. 9 Oh, save Your people and bless Your heritage! Be their Shepherd and carry them forever.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our strength and salvation come from You alone. In the midst of our uncertainties, we choose to trust in Your unfailing wisdom and guidance, for You alone know the path that leads to eternal victory. When we feel lost, may we turn our eyes to You, the source of all truth and light, that we may walk securely in Your ways. We surrender our lives to Your sovereign plan, trusting that You will direct our steps. Amen.
reflection: God alone can save you, so be sure your confidence is in Him. Only He can give you eternal victory. When you feel lost, it may be because you are looking everywhere but to God for your help and guidance.
subject: Confidence in God Alone

Today's Verses: Ps 29:10-11

10 The Lord sits enthroned over the flood; the Lord sits enthroned as king
forever. 

11 May the Lord give strength to his people! May the Lord bless his people
with peace! 

Today's Thoughts:

All through history, God has revealed His power through miracles over
nature-such 

as the great flood. He promises to continue to reveal His power. The same
power that 

raised Christ from the dead is available to help us with our daily problems.
The same 

power that controls creation and raises the dead is available to you. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, help me to cast all my cares on You,

trusting that You care for me. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

It is for freedom that Christ has set us free.

Gal. 5:1

Just as You raised Your Son Jesus from the grave, we trust that the same power dwells within us, empowering us to overcome the challenges we face each day. Lord, may we rely on Your strength and not our own, that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.

original_content:
Today's Verses: 30:6, 7

I said in my prosperity, "I shall never be moved." 7 By Your favor, O Lord, 

You made my mountain stand strong; You hid Your face; I was dismayed. 

Today's Thoughts:

Security had made David feel invincible. Although he knew his riches and 

power had come from God, they had gone to his head, making him proud.

Wealth, power, and fame usually have an intoxicating effect on people, 

making them feel self-secure, and independent from God. But this false 

security can be easily shattered.

Don't be trapped by the false security of prosperity. Instead depend on 

God for your security, and you won't be shaken when worldly possessions 

disappear. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, Help me never to fall into the trap of trusting in worldly
possessions.

Help me to keep my focus on You and the true security that You promise to
all 

who have placed their life in Your hands. Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Create in me a pure heart, O God.

Ps. 51:10
original_reflection_text: Security had made David feel invincible. Although he knew his riches and power had come from God, they had gone to his head, making him proud. Wealth, power, and fame usually have an intoxicating effect on people, making them feel self-secure, and independent from God. But this false security can be easily shattered. Don't be trapped by the false security of prosperity. Instead depend on God for your security, and you won't be shaken when worldly possessions disappear.
original_verse_text: I said in my prosperity, "I shall never be moved. " 7 By Your favor, O Lord, You made my mountain stand strong; You hid Your face; I was dismayed.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we confess that we are often tempted to find security in the fleeting things of this world, rather than in You alone. Forgive us for the times when our wealth, power, or status have made us feel invincible, causing us to drift from dependence on You. Help us to remember that our true security can only be found in Your steadfast love and unfailing presence. May we not be trapped by the false security of prosperity, but instead, may we trust in You as our rock and our refuge. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Security had made David feel invincible. Although he knew his riches and power had come from God, they had gone to his head, making him proud. Wealth, power, and fame usually have an intoxicating effect on people, making them feel self-secure and independent from God. But this false security can be easily shattered. Don't be trapped by the false security of prosperity. Instead, depend on God for your security, and you won't be shaken when worldly possessions disappear.
subject: Secure in God's Provision
verse_text: I said in my prosperity, "I shall never be moved. " 7 By Your favor, O Lord, You made my mountain stand strong; You hid Your face; I was dismayed.

Today's Verses: Ps. 31:1-2

In you, O Lord, do I take refuge; let me never be put to shame; in your
righteousness deliver me! 

2 Incline your ear to me; rescue me speedily! Be a rock of refuge for me, a
strong fortress to save me! 

Today's Thoughts:

David called upon God to deliver him. He wanted God to stop 

those who were unjustly causing trouble. David made his request 

based upon what he knew of God's name or character. 



In times like these God alone is our comfort and strength. 

Even when we are too weak to fight, we can lean on Him.

Often it is when we recognize our weakness that God's 

greatest strength becomes available. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, strengthen my faith through Your Word 

so that I can stand in heaven's victory circle. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

If we ask anything according to His will, He hears us.

I Jn. 5:14
original_reflection_text: David called upon God to deliver him. He wanted God to stop those who were unjustly causing trouble. David made his request based upon what he knew of God's name or character. In times like these God alone is our comfort and strength. Even when we are too weak to fight, we can lean on Him. Often it is when we recognize our weakness that God's greatest strength becomes available.

prayer: Heavenly Father, in this time of distress, we turn to You as our rock and fortress. We take refuge in Your unfailing love, for You are our strength and our shield. When the waves of adversity threaten to overwhelm us, we find solace in Your presence, for You are our ever-present help in times of trouble. Lord, deliver us from the schemes of the wicked, and grant us the wisdom to trust in Your mighty power. May our weakness become a platform for Your strength to be displayed. We praise You, our Mighty Deliverer. Amen.
reflection: David called upon God to deliver him. He wanted God to stop those who were unjustly causing trouble. David made his request based upon what he knew of God's name or character. In times like these, God alone is our comfort and strength. Even when we are too weak to fight, we can lean on Him. Often, it is when we recognize our weakness that God's greatest strength becomes available.
subject: Lean on God's Strength

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 31:5-6

Into your hand I commit my spirit; you have redeemed me, O Lord, faithful
God.

6 I hate those who pay regard to worthless idols, but I trust in the Lord. 

Today's thoughts:

We often say that we have faith in God-but do we fully trust Him.

David say, "Into your hand I commit my spirit," this truly conveys his trust
in God the Father.

Stephen repeated these words as he was being stoned to death, confident that
in his death he 

was simply passing from God's earthly care to God's eternal care. We should
commit our 

possessions, our families, and our vocations to God. But first and foremost,
we should 

commit ourselves completely to Him.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, fix my faith on You so that I would have complete 

confidence in You in the midst of life's trials. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Work! God wills it. That, seems to me, is clear.

Gustave Flaubert
original_reflection_text: We often say that we have faith in God-but do we fully trust Him. David say, "Into your hand I commit my spirit, " this truly conveys his trust in God the Father. Stephen repeated these words as he was being stoned to death, confident that in his death he was simply passing from God's earthly care to God's eternal care. We should commit our possessions, our families, and our vocations to God. But first and foremost, we should commit ourselves completely to Him.
original_verse_text: Into your hand I commit my spirit; you have redeemed me, O Lord, faithful God. 6 I hate those who pay regard to worthless idols, but I trust in the Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts filled with gratitude for Your steadfast love and unwavering guidance. Like David, we desire to commit our spirits fully into Your hands, trusting that You will lead us in the paths of righteousness. Help us to lean not on our own understanding, but to acknowledge You in all our ways, that You may direct our steps according to Your perfect will. May our lives be a testament to the faith we profess, as we seek to honor You in all that we do. Amen.
reflection: We often say that we have faith in God—but do we fully trust Him? David said, "Into your hand I commit my spirit," this truly conveys his trust in God the Father. Stephen repeated these words as he was being stoned to death, confident that in his death he was simply passing from God's earthly care to God's eternal care. We should commit our possessions, our families, and our vocations to God. But first and foremost, we should commit ourselves completely to Him.
subject: Commit Your Spirit to God

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 31:11-13

Because of all my adversaries I have become a reproach, especially to my
neighbors, 

and an object of dread to my acquaintances; those who see me in the street
flee from me. 

12 I have been forgotten like one who is dead; I have become like a broken
vessel. 

13 For I hear the whispering of many- terror on every side!- as they scheme
together 

against me, as they plot to take my life. 

Today's Thoughts:

In describing his own feelings, David writes of the helplessness and
hopelessness every

one feels when hated or rejected. But adversity is easier to accept when we
recognize 

our true relationship with our heavenly God. Although our enemies may seem
to have 

the upper hand, they are ultimately the helpless and hopeless ones. Those
who know 

God will be victorious in the end-We can have courage today because God will
preserve us. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Lord, for Your peace through Jesus, I thank You.

Help me sleep well because of it. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Lead me, O Lord, in Your righteousness because of my enemies; 

make Your way straight before me. Psalm 5:8
original_reflection_text: In describing his own feelings, David writes of the helplessness and hopelessness every one feels when hated or rejected. But adversity is easier to accept when we recognize our true relationship with our heavenly God. Although our enemies may seem to have the upper hand, they are ultimately the helpless and hopeless ones. Those who know God will be victorious in the end-We can have courage today because God will preserve us. .
original_verse_text: Because of all my adversaries I have become a reproach, especially to my neighbors, and an object of dread to my acquaintances; those who see me in the street flee from me. 12 I have been forgotten like one who is dead; 1 have become like a broken vessel. 13 For I hear the whispering of many- terror on every side!- as they scheme together against me, as they plot to take my life.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You in our times of distress, when we feel helpless and hopeless in the face of our enemies. Yet, we are reminded that our true strength and refuge is found in You, the Lord. Though the world may turn against us, we know that You are our light and our salvation - whom shall we fear? You are the stronghold of our lives; of whom shall we be afraid? Empower us with Your courage, that we may stand firm in the midst of adversity, trusting in Your unfailing love and protection. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: In describing his own feelings, David writes of the helplessness and hopelessness everyone feels when hated or rejected. But adversity is easier to accept when we recognize our true relationship with our heavenly God. Although our enemies may seem to have the upper hand, they are ultimately the helpless and hopeless ones. Those who know God will be victorious in the end. We can have courage today because God will preserve us.
subject: Courageous in God's Preservation

Today's Verses: Ps. 31:14-16

But I trust in you, O Lord; I say, "You are my God." 15 My times are in your
hand; 

rescue me from the hand of my enemies and from my persecutors! 

16 Make your face shine on your servant; save me in your steadfast love! 

Today's Thoughts:

When David said, "My future is in Your hands," he was expressing his belief
that 

all of his life's circumstances were under God's control. Knowing that God
loves 

and cares for us enables us to keep steady in our faith regardless of our
circumstances.

It keeps us from sinning foolishly by taking matters into our own hands or
resenting Gods 

timetable. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, remove the fear of my sinful heart. Fill it with joy because of my
Saviors birth.

Restore to me a steady faith regardless of my circumstances. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Love the Lord, all you his saints! The Lord preserves the faithful but 

abundantly repays the one who acts in pride. Psalm 31:23
original_reflection_text: When David said, "My future is in Your hands, " he was expressing his belief that all of his life's circumstances were under God's control. Knowing that God loves and cares for us enables us to keep steady in our faith regardless of our circumstances. It keeps us from sinning foolishly by taking matters into our own hands or resenting Gods timetable. .
original_verse_text: But I trust in you, O Lord; I say, "You are my God. " 15 My times are in your hand; rescue me from the hand of my enemies and from my persecutors! 16 Make your face shine on your servant; save me in your steadfast love!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our future is in Your loving hands. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts, and not lean on our own understanding. Guide us in Your paths, for we know that You will make our ways straight. May we find strength and peace in the knowledge that our lives are secure under Your watchful care. We surrender ourselves to Your perfect will, O Lord. Amen.
reflection: When David said, "My future is in Your hands," he was expressing his belief that all of his life's circumstances were under God's control. Knowing that God loves and cares for us enables us to keep steady in our faith regardless of our circumstances. It keeps us from sinning foolishly by taking matters into our own hands or resenting God's timetable.
subject: Trusting Your Future to God

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 31:23-24

23 Love the Lord, all you his saints! The Lord preserves the faithful but
abundantly repays the one who acts in pride. 

24 Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the
Lord! 

Today's Thoughts:

What David is assuring God's faithful people, is that He preserves or keeps
His faithful safe.

But the Lord despises pride and so there will be a penalty for them to
pay-Living in this world 

can be stressful so He says, "Be strong-let your heart take courage." How do
we manage that?

We can manage that because the Lord preserves His faithful ones. .

Let us remember vs. 3 of 'Amazing Grace' 

"Through many dangers, toils and snares, I have already come; tis grace 

hath brought me safe thus far and grace will lead me home"- and everyone
said Amen.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, help me sing loudly of Your amazing love and 

what it has done for me in Jesus. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Where there is no vision, the people perish. Pro. 29:18
original_reflection_text: What David is assuring God's faithful people, is that He preserves or keeps His faithful safe. But the Lord despises pride and so there will be a penalty for them to pay-Living in this world can be stressful so He says, "Be strong-let your heart take courage. " How do we manage that? We can manage that because the Lord preserves His faithful ones. Let us remember vs. 3 of 'Amazing Grace' "Through many dangers, toils and snares, I have already come; tis grace hath brought me safe thus far and grace will lead me home"- and everyone said Amen.
original_verse_text: 23 Love the Lord, all you his saints! The Lord preserves the faithful but abundantly repays the one who acts in pride. 24 Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the Lord!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You are our light and our salvation. In the midst of the dangers, toils, and snares of this world, we find refuge in Your steadfast love. You preserve the faithful, Lord, and we take courage in the knowledge that Your grace has brought us this far and will lead us home. Help us to walk in humility, for You despise the proud. May our strength come from You alone, as we trust in Your unfailing love. Amen.
reflection: What David is assuring God's faithful people is that He preserves or keeps His faithful safe. But the Lord despises pride, and so there will be a penalty for them to pay. Living in this world can be stressful, so He says, "Be strong—let your heart take courage." How do we manage that? We can manage that because the Lord preserves His faithful ones. Let us remember vs. 3 of 'Amazing Grace': "Through many dangers, toils and snares, I have already come; 'tis grace hath brought me safe thus far, and grace will lead me home"—and everyone said Amen.
subject: Preserving God's Faithful Ones
verse_text: 23 Love the Lord, all you his saints! The Lord preserves the faithful but abundantly repays the one who acts in pride. 24 Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the Lord!

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 32:1, 2

Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered. 

2 Blessed is the man against whom the Lord counts no iniquity, and in whose
spirit there is no deceit. 

Today's Thoughts:

God wants to forgive sinners-forgiveness has always been a part of His
loving nature.

He announced this to Moses (Ex. 34:6, 7). He revealed it to David-and He
dramatically 

showed it to the world through Jesus Christ. These verses convey several
aspects of God's forgiveness.

He forgives rebellion, puts sin out of sight, and clears our record of sin.

Paul quoted these verses in Ro 4:7, 8 and showed that we can have the same
joyous experience 

of forgiveness through faith in Jesus Christ.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Thank You Lord, for Your loving nature-and forgiving Spirit, thank You for 

freeing me from sin's heavy weight and for heaven's glory. .Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Blessed is the man against whom the Lord counts no iniquity.



God is better served in resisting a temptation to evil

Than in many formal prayers.

William Penn
original_reflection_text: God wants to forgive sinners-forgiveness has always been a part of His loving nature. He announced this to Moses (Exodus 34:6, 7). He revealed it to David-and He dramatically showed it to the world through Jesus Christ. These verses convey several aspects of God's forgiveness. He forgives rebellion, puts sin out of sight, and clears our record of sin. Paul quoted these verses in Romans 4:7, 8 and showed that we can have the same joyous experience of forgiveness through faith in Jesus Christ.
original_verse_text: Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered. 2 Blessed is the man against whom the Lord counts no iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your boundless mercy and grace. You forgive our rebellion, blotting out our sins and clearing our record. We rejoice in the forgiveness we have through faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ. May we walk in the light of Your love, ever grateful for the joy of being counted righteous in Your sight. Amen.
reflection: God wants to forgive sinners—forgiveness has always been a part of His loving nature. He announced this to Moses (Exodus 34:6, 7). He revealed it to David, and He dramatically showed it to the world through Jesus Christ. These verses convey several aspects of God's forgiveness. He forgives rebellion, puts sin out of sight, and clears our record of sin. Paul quoted these verses in Romans 4:7, 8 and showed that we can have the same joyous experience of forgiveness through faith in Jesus Christ.
subject: Forgiveness: at the Heart of God
verse_text: Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered. 2 Blessed is the man against whom the Lord counts no iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.

Today's Verses: Ps. 32:4, 5

4 For day and night your hand was heavy upon me; my strength was dried up as
by the heat of summer. 

5 I acknowledged my sin to you, and I did not cover my iniquity; I said, "I
will confess my transgressions 

to the Lord," and you forgave the iniquity of my sin. 

Today's Thoughts:

To confess our sins is to agree with God, acknowledging that He is right 

to declare what we have done as sinful and that we are wrong to desire 

or to do it-is to affirm our intensions of forsaking that sin, in order 

to follow Him more faithfully.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, in this incomplete world, assure me daily 

of my complete forgiveness in You. Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Christmas isn't Christmas Til it Happens in your Heart"
original_reflection_text: To confess our sins is to agree with God, acknowledging that He is right to declare what we have done as sinful and that we are wrong to desire or to do it-is to affirm our intentions of forsaking that sin, in order to follow Him more faithfully.
original_verse_text: 4 For day and night your hand was heavy upon me; my strength was dried up as by the heat of summer. 5 I acknowledged my sin to you, and I did not cover my iniquity; I said, "I will confess my transgressions to the Lord, " and you forgave the iniquity of my sin.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble and contrite hearts, acknowledging the weight of our sins. Like the Psalmist, we have felt the heavy hand of Your discipline upon us, and we recognize that our iniquities have been a burden too heavy to bear. Yet, we are grateful that You promise forgiveness to those who confess and forsake their sins. Grant us the courage to be honest about our transgressions, that we may receive Your merciful pardon and walk in the light of Your righteousness. Guide us, Lord, to turn away from our wicked ways and to seek Your will for our lives. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: To confess our sins is to agree with God, acknowledging that He is right to declare what we have done as sinful and that we are wrong to desire or to do it—is to affirm our intentions of forsaking that sin, in order to follow Him more faithfully.
subject: Confess Sins, Affirm Intentions

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 32: 8, 9

8 The Lord says, "I will guide you along the best pathway for your life. I
will advise you and watch over you.

9 Do not be like a senseless horse or mule that needs a bit and bridle to
keep it under control." 

Today's Thoughts:

The Lord describes some people as being like a horse or mule that needs to
be controlled 

by a bit and bridle. Rather then letting God guide them step by step they
stubbornly leave 

God only one option. If God wants to keep them useful for Him, He must use
discipline and 

punishment. God longs to guide us with love and wisdom rather than
punishment. He offers 

to teach us the best way to go. Accept the advice written in God's Word, and
don't let your 

stubbornness keep you from obeying God's Word.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, teach me the best way to go and fill my days with 

the happiness of knowing You have forgiven my sins in Jesus. Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

True-true-true-Christmas isn't Christmas 

Til it happens in your heart. .
original_reflection_text: The Lord describes some people as being like a horse or mule that needs to be controlled by a bit and bridle. Rather then letting God guide them step by step they stubbornly leave God only one option. If God wants to keep them useful for Him, He must use discipline and punishment. God longs to guide us with love and wisdom rather than punishment. He offers to teach us the best way to go. Accept the advice written in God's Word, and don't let your stubbornness keep you from obeying God's Word.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing our tendency to be like stubborn horses and mules, resisting Your loving guidance. Forgive us for the times we have chosen our own way over the wisdom found in Your Word. Lord, we desire to trust in You with all our hearts, not leaning on our own understanding, but acknowledging You in all our ways, that You may direct our paths. Teach us, O God, to walk humbly and obediently, following the steps You have laid out for us. May we not be controlled by bits and bridles, but willingly submit to Your perfect plan. In Jesus' name, Amen.

Rather than letting God guide them step by step, they stubbornly leave God only one option. If God wants to keep them useful for Him, He must use discipline and punishment. God longs to guide us with love and wisdom rather than punishment. He offers to teach us the best way to go. Today's Verses: Ps. 32:10-11

Many sorrows come to the wicked, but unfailing love surrounds those who
trust the Lord.

So rejoice in the Lord and be glad, all you who obey him! Shout for joy, all
you whose hearts are pure!

Today's Thoughts:

There will be trouble for everyone who keeps on sinning. People will not be
condemned 

for what they don't know but for what they do with what they know. Those who
know 

God's written Word and His law will be judged by them.

But there will be glory, honor and peace From God for all who have done
good.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Thank You Lord, for Your forgiveness that remains new for us each day.Amen.




Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

The Lord is my Light and Salvation. Ps. 27:1
original_reflection_text: There will be trouble for everyone who keeps on sinning. People will not be condemned for what they don't know but for what they do with what they know. Those who know God's written Word and His law will be judged by them. But there will be glory, honor and peace From God for all who have done good.
original_verse_text: Many sorrows come to the wicked, but unfailing love surrounds those who trust the Lord. So rejoice in the Lord and be glad, all you who obey him! Shout for joy, all you whose hearts are pure!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that we are all sinners in need of Your grace. We thank You for Your written Word, which guides us in the way of righteousness. Help us, Lord, to not only hear Your commands but to put them into practice, doing what is good and pleasing in Your sight. May we find glory, honor, and peace in obedience to Your will, for those who do what is right will not be condemned. Amen.
reflection: There will be trouble for everyone who keeps on sinning. People will not be condemned for what they don't know but for what they do with what they know. Those who know God's written Word and His law will be judged by them. But there will be glory, honor, and peace from God for all who have done good.
subject: Doing Good Brings God's Glory
verse_text: Many sorrows come to the wicked, but unfailing love surrounds those who trust the Lord. So rejoice in the Lord and be glad, all you who obey him! Shout for joy, all you whose hearts are pure!

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 33:2-3

Praise the Lord with melodies on the lyre; make music for him on the
ten-stringed harp.

3 Sing a new song of praise to him; play skillfully on the harp, and sing
with joy. 

Today's Thoughts:

People from every nation are praising God before His throne. God's message
of 

salvation and eternal life is not limited to a specific culture race or
country. 

Anyone who comes to God in repentance and faith is accepted by Him and will 

be part of His kingdom. Don't allow prejudice or bias keep you from sharing 

Christ with others. Christ welcomes all people who come believing into His
Kingdom.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, fill me with thankfulness and awe each time I hear the message 

of your salvation. Create in me a heart for the lost no matter the color 

of their skin. Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

The mind controled by the Spirit is life and peace. Ro. 8:6
original_reflection_text: People from every nation are praising God before His throne. God's message of salvation and eternal life is not limited to a specific culture race or country. Anyone who comes to God in repentance and faith is accepted by Him and will be part of His kingdom. Don't allow prejudice or bias keep you from sharing Christ with others. Christ welcomes all people who come believing into His Kingdom.
original_verse_text: Praise the Lord with melodies on the lyre; make music for him on the ten-stringed harp. 3 Sing a new song of praise to him; play skillfully on the harp, and sing with joy.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise Your name and the wonders of Your creation. Your love and salvation are not limited to any one people, but extend to all who come to You in faith. Help us to set aside our prejudices and biases, and to joyfully share the good news of Your Son with people of every nation, that they too may join the great multitude worshiping before Your throne. May Your kingdom come and Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Amen.
reflection: People from every nation are praising God before His throne. God's message of salvation and eternal life is not limited to a specific culture, race, or country. Anyone who comes to God in repentance and faith is accepted by Him and will be part of His kingdom. Don't allow prejudice or bias to keep you from sharing Christ with others. Christ welcomes all people who come believing into His kingdom.
subject: Praise from Every Nation

Today's Verses: Ps. 33:4, 5

For the word of the Lord holds true, and we can trust everything He does.

He loves whatever is just and good; the unfailing love of the Lord fills the
earth. 

Today's Thoughts:

How many times have you gotten a guarantee that was not worth the paper it
was written on?

Well we need not worry about God's promises because all of God's words are
true and trustworthy.

The Bible is reliable because unlike people, God does not lie, forget,
change His words, or leave

His promises unfulfilled. We can trust the Bible because it contains the
words of a holy, trustworthy, 

and unchanging God. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

I thank You Lord, that Your Words holds trueand that we can trust everything that You do.

I thank You for Your unfailing love. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Trust in the Lord with all your heart; do not depend on your own
understanding.

Seek His will in all you do, and He will show you which path to take. Pro.
3:5-6 (NLT)

The Bible is reliable because unlike people, God does not lie, forget, change His words, or leave His promises unfulfilled. We can trust the Bible because it contains the words of a holy, trustworthy, and unchanging God. .
original_verse_text: For the word of the Lord holds true, and we can trust everything He does. He loves whatever is just and good; the unfailing love of the Lord fills the earth.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the trustworthiness of Your Word. Your every promise is true and Your every word is flawless. We give thanks that we can rely on the unfailing faithfulness of Your Scriptures, for You are a God who does not lie or change. Help us to cling to Your reliable and life-giving truth, that we may walk in the light of Your perfect ways. In Jesus' name, Amen.

Today's Verses: Ps. 33:8, 9

Let the whole world fear the Lord, and let everyone stand in awe of him.

For when he spoke, the world began! It appeared at his command. 

Today's Thoughts:

This is merely a summary of the first chapter of Genesis. God is not

just the coordinator of natural forces. He is the Lord of creation the

almighty God. Because He is all powerful, we should revere Him in 

all that we do. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Lord, I thank you in all that You do in sustaining all that You have 

created You are still watching over me and providing for such an 

unworthy creature as me. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift.

2 Cor. 9:15
original_reflection_text: This is merely a summary of the first chapter of Genesis. God is not just the coordinator of natural forces. He is the Lord of creation the almighty God. Because He is all powerful, we should revere Him in all that we do. .
original_verse_text: Let the whole world fear the Lord, and let everyone stand in awe of him. For when he spoke, the world began! It appeared at his command.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your majesty and power, for You are the Creator of all things. You spoke, and the heavens and the earth were formed, and all that is in them came into being. We tremble before Your might, yet we also rejoice in Your love and care for us, Your beloved children. Help us to live in reverence and obedience to Your will, that we may honor and glorify Your name in all our ways. Amen.
reflection: This is merely a summary of the first chapter of Genesis. God is not just the coordinator of natural forces. He is the Lord of creation, the almighty God. Because He is all-powerful, we should revere Him in all that we do.
subject: Revere the Almighty God
verse_text: Let the whole world fear the Lord, and let everyone stand in awe of him. For when he spoke, the world began! It appeared at his command.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 33:10-12

The Lord frustrates the plans of the nations and thwarts all their schemes.

But the Lord's plans stand firm forever; his intentions can never be shaken.

What joy for the nation whose God is the Lord, whose people he has chosen as
his inheritance. 

Today's Thoughts:

"The Lord's plans stand firm." Have you ever been frustrated by the
inconsistences of others, 

our nation, and even yourself? God is completely trustworthy-His intentions
never change. 

There is a promise that whatever is good and perfect comes to us from the
Creator who never 

changes (James 1:17). When you begin to wonder if there is anyone you can
trust, remember 

that God is completely consistent. Let Him counsel you. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, I thank You that I can put my full confidence in You. I pray that
I would have a

Christ-like attitude in all my dealings with others. I pray that our nation
would once again

turn to You for Godly wisdom.In Jesus name-Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10
original_reflection_text: "The Lord's plans stand firm. " Have you ever been frustrated by the inconsistencies of others, our nation, and even yourself? God is completely trustworthy-His intentions never change. There is a promise that whatever is good and perfect comes to us from the Creator who never changes (James 1:17). When you begin to wonder if there is anyone you can trust, remember that God is completely consistent. Let Him counsel you. .
original_verse_text: The Lord frustrates the plans of the nations and thwarts all their schemes. But the Lord's plans stand firm forever; his intentions can never be shaken. What joy for the nation whose God is the Lord, whose people he has chosen as his inheritance.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that Your plans stand firm, even when our own plans and the plans of this world seem to shift and change. Help us to trust in Your perfect wisdom and sovereign will, for we know that "the counsel of the Lord stands forever" (Psalm 33:11). Guide us by Your Spirit, that we may walk in obedience to Your ways, and find our hope and security in You alone. We surrender our lives to You, the unchanging God, who works all things according to the counsel of Your will. Amen.

When you begin to wonder if there is anyone you can trust, remember that God is completely consistent. Let Him counsel you.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 33:16, 17

The best-equipped army cannot save a king, nor is great strength enough to
save a warrior.

Don't count on your warhorse to give you victory- for all its strength, it
cannot save you. 

Today's Thoughts:

"Warhorse" refers to military strength. What is being said is that because
God rules and 

overrules every nation, leaders should never put their trust in their
physical power. 

Military strength is not the basis for our hope. Our hope is in the Lord and
in His gracious 

offer to save us if we will trust in Him. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, help me to always place my trust in You-because 

You are my rock and my salvation. Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

The message of Christmas is that this visible material world 

is bound to the invisible spiritual world.

What is being said is that because God rules and overrules every nation, leaders should never put their trust in their physical power. Military strength is not the basis for our hope. Our hope is in the Lord and in His gracious offer to save us if we will trust in Him. .
original_verse_text: The best-equipped army cannot save a king, nor is great strength enough to save a warrior. Don't count on your warhorse to give you victory - for all its strength, it cannot save you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge that our strength and our hope do not lie in the might of armies or the power of weapons, but in Your sovereign rule over all nations. Help us to put our trust not in earthly powers, but in Your unfailing love and saving grace. May we seek Your guidance and wisdom, rather than relying on our own understanding. We give thanks that our salvation comes from You alone. Amen.
reflection: "Warhorse" refers to military strength. What is being said is that because God rules and overrules every nation, leaders should never put their trust in their physical power. subject: Strength in God's Sovereignty

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 33:18-20

But the Lord watches over those who fear him, those who rely on his
unfailing love.

He rescues them from death and keeps them alive in times of famine. 
We put our hope in the Lord. He is our help and our shield. 

Today's Thoughts:

This is not an ironclad guarantee that all believers will be delivered from
death 

and starvation. Thousands of Christians have been beaten to death, whipped, 

fed to lions or executed. God can (and often does) miraculously deliver His 

followers from pain and death. But sometimes, for purposes known only to 

Him, he chooses not to. When faced with these harsh realities, we must focus


on the wise judgments of God. In time of crises, we can still place our hope
in God.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, forgive me for the times I have doubted Your wisdom. 

Give me patience to wait on Your timing. Amen



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right. Phil. 4:8
original_reflection_text: This is not an ironclad guarantee that all believers will be delivered from death and starvation. Thousands of Christians have been beaten to death, whipped, fed to lions or executed. God can (and often does) miraculously deliver His followers from pain and death. But sometimes, for purposes known only to Him, he chooses not to. When faced with these harsh realities, we must focus on the wise judgments of God. In time of crises, we can still place our hope in God.
original_verse_text: But the Lord watches over those who fear him, those who rely on his unfailing love. He rescues them from death and keeps them alive in times of famine. We put our hope in the Lord. He is our help and our shield.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that Your ways are higher than our own. Though we may face trials and tribulations, we cling to the promise that You are near to the brokenhearted and save the crushed in spirit. Help us to trust in Your perfect timing and wise judgments, even when we cannot understand. In times of crisis, may our hope remain steadfast in You, the God who delivers and sustains us. Amen.
reflection: This is not an ironclad guarantee that all believers will be delivered from death and starvation. Thousands of Christians have been beaten to death, whipped, fed to lions, or executed. God can (and often does) miraculously deliver His followers from pain and death. But sometimes, for purposes known only to Him, He chooses not to. When faced with these harsh realities, we must focus on the wise judgments of God. In times of crises, we can still place our hope in God.
subject: Trusting God's Wise Judgments
verse_text: But the Lord watches over those who fear him, those who rely on his unfailing love. He rescues them from death and keeps them alive in times of famine. We put our hope in the Lord. He is our help and our shield.

Today's Verse: Ps. 34:1

I will praise the Lord at all times. I will constantly speak His praises.

Today's Thoughts:

Do you always feel like giving thanks? Not me but we can take heart, 

because in all things God works for our good if we love Him and are 

called by Him (Ro 8:28). We need not thank God for our problems but 

for the strength He is building in us through the difficult experiences 

of our life. We can be sure that God's love will see us through. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, thank You for Your grace in choosing me. I thank You 

that You know what I need to help me grow in the faith I need to 

deal with the problems of this life. Fill my heart with the joy of salvation
. Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Let your gentleness be evident to all.

The Lord is near. Phil. 4:5

Today's Verse: Ps. 34:2

I will boast only in the Lord; let all who are helpless take heart. 

Today's Thoughts:

People tend to admire three things about other people: wisdom, power and
riches.

Do not allow jealousy creep into your life. But God puts a higher priority
on 

knowing Him personally and living a life that reflects His justice and
righteousness. 

What do you want people to admire about you?

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, thank You for crafting and keeping me as something 

precious for Your Father's house. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"As for me, I will always have hope; I will praise 

You more and more." Ps. 71:14

original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 34:8

Taste and see that the Lord is good. Oh, the joys of those who take refuge
in him!

Today's Thoughts:

"Taste and see" does not mean, "Check out God's credentials."

Instead it is an invitation: "Try this, I know you will like it."

When we take that first step of obedience in following God, we cannot help 

discovering that He is good and kind. When we begin the Christian life, our 

knowledge of God is incomplete. But as we trust Him more each day, we will 

experience how good He truly is. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, Help me remember to place my hand in Yours each day

so that I would not stray from Your will, but would remain faithfully on the
path, 

You would have me follow. Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

And He will be called Wonderful Counselor. Isa. 9:6

Today's Verses: Ps. 34:9, 10

9 Let the Lord's people, show Him reverence, for those who honor Him will
have all they need.

10 Even strong young lions sometimes go hungry, but those who trust in the
Lord will lack no good thing. 

Today's Thoughts:

You say you belong to the Lord, but do you show reverence to Him?

To reverence the Lord means to show deep respect and honor to Him.

We demonstrate true reverence by our humble attitude and genuine worship.



We also need to remember that God knows what we need, and our deepest needs
are spiritual.

Many Christians, even though they face unbearable poverty and hardship still
have enough 

spiritual nourishment to live for God. David was saying that if you have God
you have all 

you really need. God is enough.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, forgive me for complaining about what I don't have, when all I
really need is You. Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

I will show wnders in the heavens and on the earth. (Joel 2:30)

Though we may face trials and tribulations, may we find our deepest needs met in Your steadfast love and provision. You alone are enough, Lord, and in You we find all that we truly need. Amen.

Today's Verses: Ps. 34:11-14

11 Come, my children, and listen to me, and I will teach you to fear the
Lord.

12 Does anyone want to live a life that is long and prosperous?

13 Then keep your tongue from speaking evil and your lips from telling lies!

14 Turn away from evil and do good. Search for peace, and work to maintain
it. 

Today's Thoughts:

Have you notice how the Bible connects the fear of the Lord (love and
reverence) with obedience?

"Fear God and obey His commandments" Eccl. 12:13. "All those who love Me
will do what I say" (Jn. 14:23)

David said a person who fears the Lord doesn't lie, turns from evil, does
good, and promotes peace.

Reverence is much more then sitting quietly in church. It includes obeying
God in the way we speak 

and in the way we treat others. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord I pray that I would always have a teachable spirit. Bridle my
tongue 

so that I would not utter any evil words. Help me to always seek to live in
peace 

with my neighbor. Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Worship the Lord your God and serve Him only." Lk. 4:8

Help us to turn away from evil and do what is good, that we may walk in obedience to Your commands. May our words and actions reflect Your love and promote peace, for those who love You will do what You say. Guide us, Lord, that we may honor You in all we do. Amen.

Today's Verses: Ps. 34:15-17

15 The eyes of the Lord watch over those who do right; his ears are open to
their cries for help.

16 But the Lord turns his face against those who do evil; he will erase
their memory from the earth.

17 The Lord hears his people when they call to him for help. He rescues them
from all their troubles. 

Today's Thoughts:

The eyes and the ears of the Lord are always open to those who live
righteously, 

and no unrighteous act ever escapes God's eye either. (God turns His face
against those who do evil.)

In other words these people will face divine intervention. God is never
indifferent to the deeds of sinful man. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Lord, help me carry everything to You in prayer with the confidence 

that is mine only in Jesus. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Be still and know that I am God. Ps. 46:10



The one thing we need is to know God better.

Lord, help us to walk in righteousness, that we may find favor in Your sight and receive the blessings You have promised to those who love and obey You. Amen.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 34:18, 19

The Lord is close to the brokenhearted; he rescues those whose spirits are
crushed. 
19 The righteous person faces many troubles, but the Lord comes to the
rescue each time. 

Today's Thoughts:

I believe we all often wish we could escape troubles-the pain of grief, 

loss, sorrow, and failure, or even small daily frustrations that constantly 

wear us down. God promises to be "close to the brokenhearted" and to be 

our source of power, courage, and wisdom, helping us through problems.

Sometimes He chooses to deliver us from those problems. When trouble 

strikes don't get frustrated with God. Instead, admit that you need His 

help and thank Him for being by your side. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, I do thank You for the many times You have spared me 

from many trials. I thank You for all the times you have given me 

the strength to handle those daily frustrations. In Jesus name. .
Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Praise the Lord for His goodness.

Guide us through the storms of life, and grant us the wisdom to lean on You, our ever-present help. Amen.
